ratings.question_text: The readings/cases/textbooks used in this course were __________ .
Out-of-class assignments for this course were ___________ to my learning.
The workload for this course in comparison to other courses was ___________.
The pace of this class was ____________ for optimal learning.
Field trips were well designed and ran smoothly.
I learned a lot from field trips.
How clearly does the instructor provide explanations of conceptual material?
How responsive to student comments was the instructor?
I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:
Apart from how well the course was taught, how valuable is the course to students with interests similar to yours?
Did you participate in a work group as part of this course?

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-14, if you wish
comments: I don't think Maureen Burke is the most effective teacher, especially on the topic of enviro-biz consulting. I can't sayI learned a whole lot from her and the success of the class really depended on who your client was and what project you were assigned to.
Value of course is very much project + client + student team dependent.

This course, and the applied nature of the material within the context of a real consulting project, isone of a kind. I learned more through this than any courses of a similar nature I have taken. I wish we had done more together as a class though, and learned from each other throughout the semester.

narratives.question_text: What were the best aspects of this course?
comments: The semester-long project provides a very applied and real-world learning aspect. The guest lectures were also useful in giving us exposure to careers in environmental consulting.
Working with a client = real-world experience
Group work and direct exposure to working with a client.

The opportunity to work with a client is one of the best things about FES. One of the best aspects of this course is being able to work with a client in an environment with lots of support and feedback. By meeting with each group weekly, students feel that they have tremendous support. Maureen is very accessible beyond these weekly meetings as well.
Opportunity to apply classroom learnings to real-life problem/project and chance to add real value by addressing a challenge that a company is facing.
Practical experience, constant (and prompt) feedback.
Working with the client directly, and the group nature of the projects.
Provides first hand experience to work on a live project.

narratives.question_text: What aspects of this course need the most improvement?
comments: I did not find the assignments outside of the project to be particularly useful. For example, the client business analysis did not seem super relevant for our project.

The classes taught by Maureen were honestly, pretty pointless. The slides she used are ancient and she covered very basic material that is already covered in the intro of the classes that were required pre-reqs for this course. The classes almost need to be eliminated-- they served no useful purpose. Maureen also required that each group meet with her once a week, and again, that was a pretty big waste of time. Maureen is quite nice, but I don't know if she's cut out to teach a class like this. She had little to offer in helping guide us in the enviro-biz consulting world.
Perhaps making all sessions mandatory and having a no-laptop policy would ensure that guest speakers have students' full attention.

I would have liked to see more communication amongst the many groups, rather than just guest speakers and than group work being done outside the class. I think we could have been learning more from each other throughout the semester.
I think its perfect.

narratives.question_text: Was the relationship between the course lectures and discussion/lab section
comments: "Discussion" sections are the meetings with Maureen. In these meetings, we students share our progress from the past week with Maureen and get her feedback. The weekly meetings thus keep us accountable and ensure that we are on the right track towards producing our final deliverable.
N/A
N/A

narratives.question_text: Discuss, if you wish, how this course fits into your overall program.  (Please feel free to describe how the course relates to your academic background.)
comments: I am interested in environmental consulting as a career and this course provided me with very useful experience in that field.

Hypothetically, the course should fit perfectly with my overall program, but I'm sad to say it did not live up to my expectations. I felt like I learned very little and gained no valuable skills from taking this course.
I focus on Industrial Ecology, or sustainability in business and industrial systems.
Critical exposure and experiential learning for anyone in industrial evolution, business and environment or energy.
Required component of MEM.
I intend to have some sort of consulting nature to my future career, working with corporations for conservation and media projects, so this was helpful in that sense.
It helped me to gain first hand experience to work on a live project.

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: To gain experience as an environmental consultant.
Because I taught it had significant application to my career goals (see previous answer).
I am interested in doing consulting work.
To get hands-on experience in understanding the process of implementing sustainability in industrial and business settings.
Required component of MEM. (or rather, a structured, existing option for fulfilling a capstone versus trying to craft one's own project)
Because I wanted to get first hand experience to work on a live project.

narratives.question_text: Did the knowledge/skills that you gained from the course meet your expectations ?
comments: Yes, for the most part.
Not at all. See previous comments.
Yes, one of the best classes I've taken for hands on work.
Yes, I learned a lot about working with the client in the short period.
Yes.

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: Bringing in different perspectives and areas of expertise is very useful in these kind of projects.
Advantages = real world experience of working in a group with diverse personalities and work ethics. Disadvantages = general disadvantages of working with highly competitive and strong personalities.
We each brought different skills and a perspective and were able to put together a detailed and comprehensive report.
Having a partner allowed each of us to use our strengths in the project. It was helpful having someone to bounce ideas off of and help keep me on task.

Advantages: everyone had skills/areas of expertise to contribute - could not have produced required deliverable without technical skills of students on team.Disadvantages: Worked with students who had little to none prior professional experience, so was frustrating/difficult to guide and manage client expectations and project process to keep project on track. difficult to manage expectations and workload.

The group nature of these projects was the core of the learning. I think it helped that the project was real, and for an an actual business client, because the group dynamic took the work seriously -- everyone contributed and didn't let it fall through the cracks.
Group work teaches you to be team player and is an essential skill in your professional life.

narratives.question_text: For students who might consider taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: Get a clear vision of your client's goals from the start to ensure that you are on the same page.

Make sure that you get a project you are truly interested and if possible, try and hand pick your teammates before hand. The most valuable part of this class is your client interaction, other than that, I don't have very positive things to say about this course.
Communicate often and clearly with your teammates and client.
Everyone should take this class! I would suggest that students look at the project options prior and make sure there is an opportunity for them to work on a project relevant to their field.
What one gets out of the course is extremely project scope + client + student team dependent, so consider proposed projects and teams. Otherwise, what you get out of it is what you put in.
Stay organized and stick to your workplan!
I would say it is an excellent course for someone who is interested in working on a live project with reputed clients.
